description: Like no one before him, Donald Trump is at once a former president, his party’s presumptive nominee to be president again, and a criminal defendant. He faces felony charges in four separate cases for conduct before, during and after his presidency, including conspiring to defraud the US in his efforts to overturn his 2020 election loss, mishandling classified documents, and falsifying business records to cover up hush money to an adult film actress. This unprecedented situation raises a host of
title: How a Reelected Trump Could Make His Criminal Cases Go Away

description: A Zimbabwe politician’s son was arrested on charges of illegally possessing a StarLink terminal, a sign of the risks in countries where the SpaceX technology isn’t licensed.
title: Zimbabwe Arrests Cabinet Minister’s Son for Using StarLink Services

description: California Governor Gavin Newsom’s latest budget proposal looks to slash 10,000 unfilled jobs from the state’s roster and cut tens of billions of dollars in spending to close a gaping deficit left by inflation and a plunge in tax revenue from wealthy earners.
title: California Governor Calls for 10,000 Fewer Jobs, Spending Cuts

description: The UK government is stepping up preparations to sell shares in NatWest Group Plc amid growing hopes it will be able to cut the taxpayer-owned stake to a negligible amount by the end of the year, according to several people familiar with the matter.
title: UK Government Speeds Up Plans to Dispose of NatWest Stake

description: The prosecutors in Donald Trump’s hush money trial said they could rest their case next week.
title: Prosecutors in Trump Hush Money Trial Say They Could Rest Case Next Week

description: Peruvian prosecutors on Friday detained two people close to President Dina Boluarte, increasing pressure on an embattled leader who has been plagued by scandals and criminal investigations.
title: Detention of Peru Leader’s Brother Boosts Pressure on Boluarte

description: A warning light for Italy’s finances just flashed for Premier Giorgia Meloni after her government pressed ahead with a debt sale to consumers even though it knew demand would weaken.
title: Meloni Gets Warning Light as Italian Retail-Bond Demand Wanes

description: The United Nations General Assembly voted overwhelmingly Friday to grant Palestinians additional rights at the world body, a largely symbolic show of international support amid growing calls for a cease-fire in Israel’s war against Hamas.
title: UN General Assembly Vote Shows Broad Palestinian Support

description: President Joe Biden’s top economic adviser pledged Democrats would push to reverse Donald Trump’s corporate tax cuts next year, setting up a battle with Republicans over a tax law with provisions slated to expire at the end of 2025.
title: Brainard Vows Corporate Tax Hike With Trump Cuts Set to Expire

description: Steve Bannon, a longtime adviser to former President Donald Trump, failed to persuade a federal appellate panel in Washington to toss his conviction for contempt of Congress.
title: Steve Bannon Loses Bid to Overturn Contempt of Congress Conviction

description: Israel’s war cabinet on Thursday approved a “limited” expansion of the military operation in the southern Gaza city of Rafah, Kan News reported, an effort intended to avoid a head-on confrontation with US President Joe Biden.
title: Israel Approves ‘Limited’ Expansion of Rafah Operation, Kan Says

description: A Nigerian journalist who was detained for nine days without trial was released Friday following protests from civil rights groups, who accused the government of trying to gag the media amid a cost of living crisis in Africa’s most populous nation.
title: Nigeria Frees Journalist Who Was Detained Under Cyber Crime Law

description: One key American official is quietly keeping Washington’s lines of communication open across the Middle East as the US and Israel endure their worst falling-out in decades over the war in Gaza.
title: US Spy Chief Becomes Key Envoy as Biden-Netanyahu Ties Fray

description: Dutch election winner Geert Wilders and his partners in the Netherlands’ ongoing coalition talks are poised to decide on the country’s next leader as soon as next week, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Wilders May Tap Next Dutch Prime Minister as Soon as Next Week

description: A House committee has invited Brad Smith, Microsoft Corp.’s president, to testify about how the company is responding to hacks into US government officials’ Microsoft-powered email accounts and other breaches.
title: Congress Wants Microsoft’s Smith Testimony on Email Hacks

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said Russia started a new offensive against territory around Ukraine’s second-biggest city as Kremlin forces moved to breach the border in the northeast.
title: Zelenskiy Says Russia Is Attempting a New Offensive Near Kharkiv

description: Hungary agreed to deepen ties with Chinese telecom equipment maker Huawei Technologies Co. during President Xi Jinping’s visit to Budapest this week, a move that’s poised to further strain the country’s relationship with Western allies.
title: Hungary Deepens Huawei Ties During Xi Visit, Shunning Risks

description: The public spending frenzy that Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan built his political career on is set to cool as the government prepares to freeze new projects in order to focus on fighting inflation.
title: Erdogan’s Public Spending Craze to Pause Over Inflation Fight

description: Islamic State-linked insurgents attacked the town of Macomia in Mozambique’s gas-rich Cabo Delgado province, according to people with knowledge of the matter, in what is their boldest raid in more than three years.
title: Islamic State Stages Boldest Attack in Mozambique in Three Years

description: Singapore’s outgoing Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong said the new leadership team is ready to take on whatever foreign policy tests there may be, as the city-state tries to navigate through increasing tensions across the globe.
title: Singapore New Guard Ready for Foreign Policy Tests, Lee Says

description: South Africa’s energy ministry signaled it may grant fewer oil exploration permits to Shell Plc over the company’s plans to exit the nation’s fuel-supply business.
title: South Africa May Curb Shell’s Oil Exploration Over Gas-Pump Exit

description: President Joe Biden is set to tariff sectors at the heart of China’s economic recovery, in a seemingly bold swipe at his nation’s biggest rival. In reality, the curbs will barely dent Beijing’s growth.
title: Biden’s Plan to Hit China With More Tariffs Is Mostly Symbolic

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: The US-China Chip Contest Is Entering a New Phase

description: India’s Supreme Court has granted interim bail to Delhi’s Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal until the end of the ongoing elections, allowing a key leader in the opposition alliance to campaign against Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s Bharatiya Janata Party.
title: Indian Opposition Leader Gets Interim Bail for National Election

description: For the full experience visit: How Israel’s Rafah Operation Threatens Gaza’s Critical Aid Pipeline
title: How Israel’s Rafah Operation Threatens Gaza’s Critical Aid Pipeline

description: Bassirou Diomaye Faye took office in March after nearly a year in prison for allegedly spreading misinformation
title: Senegal’s Fake News Law Crushed Dissent and Helped Elect a President

description: Protesters demanding Harvard University disclose and divest from companies linked to Israel said they would “stay in our tents” and continue an encampment in Harvard Yard, according to an Instagram post and the school newspaper.
title: Harvard Protesters Vow to Continue Encampment After Talks Fail

description: Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman will travel to Japan later this month on a rare trip outside of the Middle East.
title: Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince to Visit Japan Later This Month

description: Volodymyr Zelenskiy dismissed the head of the unit that protects Ukraine’s top officials following the arrest of two colonels who were allegedly involved in a Russian plot to assassinate the president.
title: Zelenskiy Fires Bodyguard Chief After Arrest of Two Officers

description: Yemen’s Iran-backed Houthi militants have disturbed global trade with attacks on commercial ships in the Red Sea. One African country has been playing a major role in Western allies efforts to contain those attacks. This week on the Next Africa Podcast Jennifer Zabasajja and Simon Marks discuss why Djibouti’s strategic importance in the region is providing the country with an economic boost.
title: Next Africa: The Country Key To Keeping The Red Sea Safe?

description: The audio recording of a purported phone call between a Chinese diplomat and a Philippine military official “should not be allowed to pass unsanctioned,” said the country’s national security adviser who sought the immediate deportation of all those involved.
title: Philippines Slams China for ‘Serious Breaches’ Over Audio Claim

description: When Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez clawed together an unlikely collection of separatist parties to form his first government in 2018, his route to power passed through Catalonia. Now, the autonomous region may lie on his path to defeat.
title: Pedro Sanchez’s Catalan Partners Are Getting Ready to Turn Against Spanish PM

description: President Vladimir Putin has asked the Russian parliament to reappoint Mikhail Mishustin as prime minister.
title: Putin Asks Lawmakers to Reappoint Mishustin as Russian Premier

description: Other than photo opportunities and some local delicacies, Chinese President Xi Jinping didn’t get — or give — much during his two days in France with President Emmanuel Macron this week. Yet Xi’s swing through Eastern Europe proved more productive, allowing him to add Serbia to the list of countries supporting his vision of global order and lean into the increasingly strained relationship between Hungary and the European Union. Although Xi talked about avoiding a “new Cold War,” his diplomacy ha
title: How Xi’s Europe Trip Is Reviving Europe’s Cold War Divide

description: President Joe Biden’s administration is poised to unveil a sweeping decision on China tariffs as soon as next week, one that’s expected to target key strategic sectors with new levies while rejecting the kind of across-the-board hikes sought by Donald Trump, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Biden Poised to Impose Tariffs on China EVs, Strategic Sectors

description: On this episode of Voternomics, we hear why voter satisfaction with Western governments is at an unprecedented low.
title: What’s Worse Than Inflation? ‘Useless Politicians’

description: As India’s general election nears the halfway mark, falling voter turnout is prompting concerns about voter disengagement in the world’s largest poll.
title: India’s Lower Voter Turnout Raises Questions About BJP Fatigue
